III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention (a) Any type of physical punishment including but
not limited to: (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff verbally threatened youth and put hands around youth's
neck.
Investigation On 9/3/24 DCWL received an allegation from Complainant 1
indicating that on 9/2/24 Youth A was verbally threated by Staff 1.
Staff 1 allegedly stated that he was going to “blow his stuff out”.
Staff 1 then chased Youth A to the gym area and put his hands
around Youth A’s neck. No marks or bruises were observed.
Complainant 1 further reported that Youth A is afraid of Staff 1 and
Staff 2. Youth A was previously in fights with unknown staff for
unknown reasons. Complainant 1 did not witness these events.
Complainant 1 received a report of this information from someone
else. Complainant was contacted on 9/4/24 and reported no
additional information.
Interviews:
Chief Administrator was interviewed face-to-face on 9/4/24 at
the facility in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Chief
Administrator reported she was unaware of any fights with staff, or
any staff making threats to Youth A. Chief Administrator was
surprised by the allegation and described Staff 1 as very calm and
patient. Chief Administrator reported there was not an incident
report regarding Youth A for 9/2/24. However, they located an
incident report involving Youth A, Staff 1, Staff 2 and Staff 3. The
incident occurred on 8/31/24.
Youth A was AWOL on 9/4/24 and could not be interviewed during
the initial on-site visit. An interview was completed face-to-face at
the facility on 9/12/24 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth
A was observed to be free of marks on his neck. Youth A stated he
2

had a scratch on his arm and a bruise on his elbow, but he did not
know where they came from. Youth A said he was arguing with
Staff 1 one day. Staff 1 tried to grab his neck, but he ran away, and
Staff 1 did not grab him. Youth A stated he was not injured and
was not restrained by staff. Youth A stated that Staff 1 threatened
him with his “homies and they had guns”. Youth A stated he has
not had any issues at the facility and has not gone AWOL at all.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face on 9/4/24 at the facility in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported he was
watching from a distance on 9/2/24 when Youth A was restrained
by staff. Youth B stated that Youth A was not choked, and the
restraint looked correct in his opinion. Youth B stated that he has
never heard staff threaten Youth A. In fact, Youth A was the one
making threats at staff that day.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 9/12/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 recalled a restraint with
Youth A on 9/2/24 and stated it was necessary because Youth A
was being violent with staff and not responding to verbal
redirection. Staff tried to give Youth A space, but he would charge
at staff using sticks as weapons, spitting, biting, and punching.
Staff placed Youth A in a supine hold with Staff 2 and Staff 3. This
only lasted a few minutes. When they began to disengage, Youth
A began attacking staff again and they immediately placed him
back in the hold. Staff 1 denied choking or threatening Youth A at
any time. Staff 1 stated that when Youth A was released from the
restraint, he ran into the neighborhood, yelling that staff had raped
and attacked him. Youth A had a history of yelling out allegations
when upset.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face on 9/4/24 at the facility in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported he was called
for assistance with Youth A on 9/2/24. Staff 2 assisted in the
restraint due to Youth A physically assaulting staff. Staff 3 also
assisted in the hold. Staff 2 never observed Staff 1’s hands to be
on Youth A’s neck. Staff 2 never made any threats to Youth A, nor
did he hear any threats from other staff. When Youth A began to
relax, staff released him from the hold. However, Youth A
immediately began to attack staff again and was placed back into
the hold for less than five minutes. When Youth A was released
again, he stood up and ran away from staff. Youth A then ran into
the community, yelling that staff were hurting him. One neighbor
was outside and observed Youth A yelling that he was being hurt,
despite staff having already stepped away from him.
3

Staff 2 did not have any concerns about Staff 1 and never
observed him to threaten or be aggressive with youth. Staff 2
stated that Staff 1 is typically the staff that kids like to be around
because he is good at building relationships.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face on 9/4/24 at the facility in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported he was
involved in the incident with Youth A on 9/2/24. Staff 3 recalled the
group was getting ready to go on an outing. Youth A decided he
did not want to go, as he wanted to stay and play with a peer.
However, once everyone left for the outing, the peer was injured
and did not want to play, which upset Youth A. Youth A was yelling
at staff and became physically aggressive. Staff attempted to talk
with Youth A and deescalate him. However, Youth A continued to
punch at Staff 1 and try to hit him with sticks. Youth A was
restrained briefly as he was hurting people. Staff 3 was part of the
restraint with Staff 1 and Staff 2. Youth A was released within a
few minutes but continued to attack staff again. Staff placed Youth
A back in the hold for about five minutes. When Youth A was
released from the hold he spit at staff and ran from staff screaming
that he had been raped. Youth A was walking down the street
yelling to neighbors that he was being abused. Staff followed
Youth A as he went AWOL, attempting to talk with him. Youth A
then laid on the ground and screamed that staff were attacking
him. A neighbor saw this and though staff were beating up Youth
A. Staff 3 reported he never saw Staff 1 put his hands on Youth A’s
neck. Staff 3 did not hear any verbal threats from any staff toward
Youth A. Staff 3 did not have any concerns about Staff 1 or Staff 2.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face on 9/4/24 at the facility in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 did not have any
concerns about how Staff 1 or Staff 2 interact with Youth A. Staff 4
stated that Staff 1 is very calm. Staff 4 never heard any verbal
threats, nor did he see any staff improperly restrain, grab, or injure
a child.
Foster Care Worker was contacted on 9/26/24 via video call.
Foster Care Worker stated that meetings occur weekly to discuss
placement options, due to Youth A’s behavior and frequent
truancy. Youth A has left the facility for several hours at a time,
then returned when he wanted to eat or shower, then left again.
Staff have followed Youth A. However, he will go through alleys,
thick brush, or abandoned houses and staff lose sight of him. Staff
also must be cautious as the community members are not always
friendly and have threatened staff, due to allegations made by
4

youth. Youth A has a history of shouting false allegations when
upset.
Documents Reviewed:
• Foster Care record indicated Youth A was placed at the
facility from 6/19/24 to 10/11/24. Youth A went AWOL 69
times while placed at Wolverine Center.
• Human Resources record for Staff 1 was reviewed. Staff 1
was current on training and most recently completed Crisis
Prevention Institute Nonviolent Crisis Intervention (NVCI)
training on 7/15/24. Staff 1 did not have any disciplinary
action on file.
• Incident report dated 8/31/24, Staff 1, Staff 2 and Staff 3
were identified as participants. Youth A began to hit a staff
members car with a branch. Staff called for assistance and
Youth A moved on from the car and began to AWOL. Staff
redirected Youth A back to the building. Youth A then
began to physically assault staff by throwing rocks and
trying to punch staff. He then began to swing a stick at
staff, but staff was able to remove it. Youth A began
punching staff again. Youth A was placed in a supine hold
for 6 minutes. When staff began to release Youth A and
back away, Youth A began to chase staff and hit them. The
supine restraint was initiated again and lasted five minutes.
Youth A was released and continued to assault staff, then
went AWOL. Youth A picked up rocks and threw them at
staff, then began to scream to get the neighbors attention.
Youth A then screamed he was being beaten up and raped.
Staff backed away until Youth A began to calm down.
Youth A then returned to the building.
• 9/6/24 Incident Report- Youth A was taken to hospital for a
physical abuse exam at the request of MDHHS. MDHHS
was on the phone during the exam. The After Visit
Summary from the hospital indicated imaging was
completed on youth’s elbow, knee and shoulder due to
bruises. No injuries were determined.
• Behavior Support and Management policy indicates staff
are to use non-violent restrictive intervention to contain a
client’s acute physical behavior, to maximize safety and
minimize harm. This is only to be used to protect client or
others from unanticipated or severely aggressive behavior
that places them at serious threat of violence or injury if no
immediate intervention occurs. Staff are to use NVCI
methods as trained.
5

Analysis Based on interviews with youth and staff, there is insufficient
information to determine a violation. Youth A denied Staff 1
grabbed his neck and threatened him. All other staff and youth
interviewed reported they never witnessed Staff 1 or any staff,
grab or threaten Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Health services; policies and procedures.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and
behavioral health care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was hit in the head several times by a peer. Staff did not
obtain medical attention despite the youth having a seizure
disorder.
Investigation On 9/3/24 DCWL received an allegation from Complainant 2
indicating that Youth A was injured by Youth B on 8/29 or 8/30/24.
Youth A was hit in the head several times and did not receive
medical attention, despite having a seizure disorder. Complainant
2 did not witness this event.
Interviews:
Chief Administrator was interviewed face-to-face on 9/4/24 at
the facility in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Chief
Administrator reported that Youth A did not have a seizure
disorder that the facility was aware of. Any time Youth A was
involved in an incident, he was offered medical care. However,
Youth A often refused but would later change his mind.
Youth A was AWOL on 9/4/24 and could not be interviewed at the
initial on-site visit. An interview was completed face-to-face at the
facility on 9/12/24 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A
stated that he did not get along well with Youth B, but never had
problems with him. Youth A then stated he did have some
problems with Youth B but could not recall what they were. Youth
A stated he had never been in a fight or had any physical incidents
with Youth B and did not have any injuries from Youth B.
6

Youth B was interviewed face-to-face on 9/4/24 at the facility in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B recalled the day that
he and Youth A were in an altercation. Youth B stated Youth A spit
in his face. Youth B chased and punched Youth A. Staff stepped in
and separated the youth. Youth B was unsure if Youth A received
a medical clearance.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face on 9/4/24 at the facility in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 recalled being present
during the incident between Youth A and Youth B. As Staff 4 was
exiting the gym with Youth B, Youth A walked past and spit on
Youth B. Youth B immediately reacted by chasing Youth A. Staff 4
ran after the boys but could not reach them before Youth B was
able to punch Youth A in the face. Staff 4 separated the youth and
removed Youth B from the area. Additional staff assisted Youth A.
Staff 4 stated that protocol is to go to the doctor after a fight. Youth
A initially refused to go that day. Staff 4 was unsure if he changed
his mind and went for a medical later in the day. Staff 4 stated that
Youth A often refuses initially, then asks to go later.
Documents Reviewed
• Foster Care record indicated Youth A was placed at the
facility from 6/19/24 to 10/11/24. There was no
documentation in Youth A’s medical record to indicate a
seizure disorder.
• Incident report dated 8/30/24.Staff reported that Youth B
heard a peer yelling and cursing at staff. Youth B ran to see
what was happening and observed Youth A spitting at staff.
Youth B ran and punched Youth A. Staff immediately
separated the youth. Youth A attempted to spit at Youth B.
Youth B pushed Youth A to the ground and hit him again.
Staff separated them and nothing further occurred. A body
chart was attached to the incident report and noted no
injuries to Youth A or Youth B.
• A discharge summary from Children’s Hospital of Michigan
Emergency Department dated 8/30/24 was reviewed. The
summary indicated no injury or illness requiring additional
care for Youth A.
Analysis No violation was found as it was determined the agency provided
sufficient medical care to Youth A on the date of the physical
altercation between Youth A and Youth B.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
